dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 663 IH: Carson National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ben Ray Luján of New Mexico introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To adjust the boundary of the Carson National Forest, New Mexico.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Carson National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act.

subsection.text: The boundary of the Carson National Forest in the State of New Mexico is adjusted to incorporate the approximately 4,990 acres of land generally depicted as “Miranda Canyon Boundary” on the map entitled Carson National Forest Boundary Adjustment and dated September 21, 2010.

For purposes of section 7 of the Land and Water Conservation Fund Act of 1965 (16 U.S.C. 460l–9), the boundaries of the Carson National Forest, as modified under subsection (a), shall be considered to be the boundaries of the Carson National Forest as in existence on January 1, 1965.
